equipment.name: D.O.T.S. Projector
equipment.description: Creates a field of green lights when placed. Used to detect D.O.T.S Projector evidence.
equipment.mechanics: The D.O.T.S Projector is a piece of electronic starter equipment, as well as a type of evidence, that can be used to reveal the ghost's movement.

tiers.description: A handheld projector that can be used while moving. Use it near ghost activity and scan for a physical form that may appear!
This small projector emits a medium sized sphere of light. Place it on the floor for the best coverage of small to medium-sized rooms.

For the best coverage, place this projector on a wall or upright surface, stand nearby, and watch as it scans the environment. To increase coverage even more, place two projectors opposite each other to fill entire rooms with infrared light!

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: The D.O.T.S Projector can be placed on a wall or floor similar to a motion sensor. It emits a matrix of bright green laser points in a small area from the projector. Tier I D.O.T.S Projector additionally can be held and toggled to create a cone of D.O.T.S light where it is pointed. The Tier I D.O.T.S Projector will not work if Flashlights are turned off in custom difficulty settings. Ghosts with D.O.T.S evidence will occasionally enter a 'D.O.T.S state'. During this, a faint silhouette of the ghost will be visible only when it passes through the laser grid. The ghost will also walk towards the nearest player if there is one in the same room, or towards a random waypoint if no players are nearby. While these silhouettes are visible to the naked eye (unless the ghost is a Goryo), a video camera with night vision may allow for better visibility. This also means that D.O.T.S can be tracked simultaneously alongside Ghost Orbs. Dead players cannot see the D.O.T.S state by any means. Though the D.O.T.S Projector is an electronic equipment, only the Tier I D.O.T.S. Projector when activated and held will attract the ghost to the player during a hunt, and they are otherwise safe to hold onto.

notes.title: Photo Rewards
notes.description: The D.O.T.S silhouette can be photographed and will show up as Ghost, rewarding up to $20 and 20 XP depending on the photo distance. This photo will complete the 'Capture a photo of the Ghost' objective without needing a Ghost Event to occur.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: A good way to see the D.O.T.S silhouette clearly is to have the room lights turned off and use a video camera with night vision on, then look either directly through the video camera screen or the computer. This will increase the silhouette's contrast against the background. Having two D.O.T.S Projectors placed can allow the silhouette to be visible for longer as it moves across the lighting radius. If the favourite room is small, consider placing the D.O.T.S Projector in a neighbouring room to aid visibility. The Projector emits a substantial amount of light when placed. Investigators can use them for illumination, especially with a spare Projector or when D.O.T.S evidence can be safely crossed off. Note that the D.O.T.S projector light does not mitigate sanity drain. The Tier II and III D.O.T.S Projectors can be placed on some ceilings in a few maps, which may allow the light to cover a room with much more consistency. This is especially useful for the tier III projector, whose sweeping motions and cone-shaped light area can cause the ghost to potentially leave its light prematurely depending on the ghost's and the projector's movement. The green light emitted may obscure nearby fingerprints or footprints; look carefully or remove the projector when checking for ultraviolet evidence. Some visual effects such as freezing breath or Incense smoke will reflect the D.O.T.S Projector's light. Be careful to not confuse them with a D.O.T.S silhouette. There is currently a bug where the ghost can initiate a ghost event or a hunt while in 'D.O.T.S state'. This will make the ghost entirely invisible and nearly quiet (footsteps will not be heard) outside of a D.O.T.S. Projector's range.

equipment.name: EMF Reader
equipment.description: The EMF reader is a buyable piece of equipment used to read the strength of electromagnetic fields in the nearby environment. The EMF reader is used to detect evidence of EMF Level 5.
equipment.mechanics: The reader can be toggled on to begin reading any emissions. The device's effective range, as well as how the reading is displayed, is dependent on the tier of the EMF Reader. Holding an active EMF reader within 7.5 metres of a ghost (or 2.5 metres for a Yokai) during a hunt on the same floor will attract the ghost. During hunts or when the ghost manifests, EMF readers within 10 metres of the ghost (or higher for a Raiju) will malfunction and display random values between level 1 and 4.

tiers.description: Switch this EMF meter on and scan anything that moves to see if you get a reading. If the needle starts to move rapidly above a reading of 5, you've found some evidence!

The K2 meter has a larger range and five LED lights to display EMF readings, as well as an additional speaker module. One light will turn on when you activate the device, two to four lights will emit for general interactions, and all five lights will glow when evidence has been found!

This EMF Reader can track up to three EMF spots at once. For each of them it will display the range, a directional display and the intensity of the reading. Once an EMF spot fades away, the remaining readings will be pushed up in the list on the screen, so that the newest one is always at the bottom. Each EMF reading will also play a beeping sound periodically, a higher pitch note relates to a higher intensity of EMF!

notes.title: Tier 1
notes.description: The Tier I EMF Reader is an old GheistField Meter. It is reminiscent of an old Geiger counter, and has a 1.7 metre range at which it can pick up readings. When in range of an EMF reading, it will begin clicking and the dial will move to the rough area corresponding to the value of the EMF source, though the dial will sway up or down a bit due to its age. When EMF Level 5 is detected, the dial will quickly shoot all the way to the right, and sway a lot less down, staying at and far past the level 5 mark (staying at and below does not count).

notes.title: Tier 2
notes.description: The Tier II EMF Reader is the K2 Meter. The K2 is a small black box adorned with five colored LED lights, each one indicating a different EMF reading. The K2 has an effective range of 2 metres. When detecting an EMF emission, the reader will light up various numbers of its LEDs, accompanied with a pitch associated with the measured reading's level. If multiple EMF emissions are in range, the one with the highest EMF level will be indicated by the reader, though some fine positioning may be able to change which reading its being given out. When EMF Level 5 is detected, all five lights will be illuminated, and it will make a very high pitch tone.

notes.title: Tier 3
notes.description: The Tier III EMF Reader is the EMF ParaMeter. It is similar in design to a PDA, with a blocky black plastic shell and a large center screen. It has a 3.5 meter range. It is able to read and track up to three interactions at once, giving the reading's EMF level by filling in dashes, and additionally reads out how far away that the reading occurred from the device (in meters) as well as the direction at which the interaction happened, allowing for the holder to quickly track down where the EMF emission is sourced from. When detecting something that is not EMF Level 5, it will create a beeping sound. When detecting EMF Level 5, all dashes will fill and a unique beeping noise that is higher pitched will play.

notes.title: EMF Lvel 5
notes.description: If the ghost has EMF Level 5 as a possible piece of evidence, each EMF occurrence of Levels 2 or 3 has a 25% chance to be a Level 5 emission instead. EMF Level 5 does not necessarily indicate strong activity or immediate danger to the player.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: If players are looking for evidence of EMF Level 5, players should use the reader every time the ghost touches an object or surface, and within the 20 second period that the EMF will be active for. It may be possible to mishear a pitch for EMF 5, especially with certain speakers. Visually read off the EMF level to be certain. EMF Readers, especially Tier II readers, create a substantial amount of noise when malfunctioning, making discarded ones good beacons of the ghost's general location during a hunt.

emf_levels.ghost_activity: Interacting with an object. Using an ability

equipment.name: Ghost Writing Book
equipment.description: Used to obtain Ghost Writing from a ghost.
equipment.mechanics: The Ghost Writing Book is a piece of equipment used to obtain Ghost Writing by placing it near a ghost.

tiers.description: This paper notepad can be placed nearby a ghost to encourage some paranormal writing. Make sure to place it nearby any activity you see. Some ghosts may not notice the small notepad and pencil, so it may take some time before anything happens.
With nicer pages and a pen, ghosts seem to notice this book a bit more often than the previous version, making wait times a bit shorter for evidence to occur.

With its large profile, a mixture of high-quality materials and an ornate pen, this book has the highest chance to be written in by ghosts. It has a larger range than the previous two tiers so placing this book within a ghost's interaction range is much easier.

notes.title: Placement
notes.description: A translucent preview of the Ghost Writing Book opened will appear while the player is aiming at a surface and holding down the Secondary Use key. The book will be placed when the key is released.

notes.title: Function
notes.description: If Ghost Writing is an evidence type for the ghost, the ghost has a chance of interacting with the book by writing in it. When this happens, the book will slightly levitate and the pen will start to frantically scribble on the pages visually and audibly, followed by the pen being thrown on the ground. An EMF Level 2 reading is also created, with a 25% chance of it being EMF Level 5 instead if this is one of the ghost's types of evidence. The ghost will not write in the book if it is closed and/or out of range. A ghost can throw the Ghost Writing Book only if it does not have Ghost Writing among its types of evidence or when that piece of evidence is hidden. After being thrown, the book will close.

notes.title: Photo Rewards
notes.description: Using a photo camera to take a photo of a ghost writing book with writing will yield a photo labelled as Ghost Writing, and reward up to $5 and 5XP, depending on the distance it was taken from. A photo labelled as Interaction, awarding up to $5 and 5XP, can be taken as well within 20 seconds of the book being written in.

notes.title: Strategies
notes.description: If placed within the vision of an active video camera, you can use the Video Feed in the truck to watch ghost writing books and see if ghost writing is occurring. While it may be much more difficult to see if there are any markings in the pages on camera, more observant players may check if the pen is missing from the book to determine if ghost writing has occurred or not. A nearby sound sensor can be also used to monitor a Ghost Writing Book from the van; this will allow players to hear the sound of Ghost Writing occuring without having to actively monitor the book. The ghost will try to write in a book every 45 to 90 seconds. The higher the tier of the book is, the more likely it is to succeed. Writing will only happen if the ghost is in the interaction range of the book. Using both books to cover the whole room can increase the chance of getting Ghost Writing. If you notice that the ghost writing book has been thrown, check whether it already has writing before eliminating Ghost Writing as an evidence (that is not hidden, if applicable).

equipment.name: Spirit Box
equipment.description: Used to communicate with a ghost through questions.
equipment.mechanics: The Spirit Box is a piece of equipment used to find Spirit Box evidence. It creates white noise by constantly cycling through various radio frequencies, which allows the ghost to communicate with players.

tiers.description: When turning this Spirit Box on, it will begin to scan through different radio frequencies. Make sure to stand near to any paranormal activity, turn off any lights in that room, and ask some questions in the hope of a response. If the question has been heard, a red light will flash on the Spirit Box, if it flashes white, you've got a response. Try asking 'Where are you?' or 'Are you friendly?'. Be warned, you may not like the answer you receive.

This more modern Spirit Box has a higher-quality speaker and is much more efficient at scanning through frequencies, making paranormal responses easier to deciper. If a question has been heard, a black X will flash on the screen, if you get a response, the small ghost icon will flash instead.

When turned on, this Spirit Box scans both frequencies of radio at the same time, increasing the chance of picking up a paranormal response when asking questions. It also has a built-in noise filter, to reduce the amount of static you hear between interactions. If a question is heard and no response is given, the RESPONSE LEDs will flash red. If a reply is given, the LEDs will flash white in time with the sound.

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: The Spirit Box can be turned on via toggle. The Spirit Box emits a constant static noise while active. The microphone LED/icon will indicate whether or not the Spirit Box is listening (when Push To Talk or Toggle is used), or receiving microphone input (when Voice Activation is used).

notes.title: Questioning
notes.description: There are three ways to probe for a response via the Spirit Box: If using voice chat, the Spirit Box will recognise any valid question asked by the player... If using the text-based UI, the UI will appear upon turning on the Spirit Box. Players can then click to select one of 3 questions. The player can exit the UI by turning off the Spirit Box... If the player selects Vosk, Windows, or None as the voice recognition method, having voice chat active (by holding the push-to-talk button or selecting Voice Activation) will enable the Spirit Box to automatically 'ping' a question every 10 seconds. If nothing happens upon asking a question, it is possible the game did not recognise any valid phrase, or the player's voice recognition is not working properly. Note that the microphone LED/icon shows whether the game is picking up the player's microphone only if the player's voice chat option is set to Voice Activation. When using the Windows voice recognition system, this does not necessarily mean that the system is working properly.

notes.title: Answering
notes.description: When a question is successfully registered, the Spirit Box will return one of two results: If all the relevant conditions are met and the chance is successful, the ghost LED will turn white on a Tier I Spirit Box, the ghost icon will display on a Tier II Spirit Box, the response LEDs will turn white on a Tier III Spirit Box, and a distorted voice line will be heard through the Spirit Box. This is considered as evidence of Spirit Box... If the ghost LED turns red on a Tier I Spirit Box, the 'X' icon displays on a Tier II Spirit Box, or the response LEDs turn red on a Tier III Spirit Box, one or more of the conditions listed below have not been met.

notes.title: Evidence Requirements
notes.description: In order to get a successful Spirit Box response from the ghost, all of the following is required: The ghost has Spirit Box as one of its types of evidence, The player must be in the same room as the ghost, The player must be within a certain range of the ghost (3 metres with a Tier I, 4 metres with a Tier II, and 5 metres with a Tier III), All lights in said room must be off. Light emitted from equipment, including electronic and non-electronic equipment, does not affect this. Lights in other rooms, including rooms or hallways that are directly adjacent, may be left on, and any doors between the rooms can stay open, Ghosts which respond only to 'people who are alone' will respond only if there is a single person in the room at the moment the question is asked. If the ghost is noted to respond to everyone, the number of people in the room does not affect the ghost's ability to respond. If the difficulty has a setup time (e.g. Amateur and Intermediate), this will be indicated on the corkboard and in the journal, If all other conditions are met, there is a chance of the ghost responding per question asked. The chance depends on the tier of the Spirit Box. If the player is particularly unlucky, a combination of these factors may cause the Spirit Box to repeatedly turn the LEDs red, or show an 'X', despite the ghost having Spirit Box as one of its evidences. Other than the need for the Spirit Box to be near the player, there are no further checks on where the Spirit Box itself is.

notes.title: Interference
notes.description: The Spirit Box is considered an electronic equipment. When interfered with, all the LEDs/icons will flicker rapidly. During a hunt, holding an active Spirit Box within 7.5 metres of a ghost on the same floor will attract it to the player. Note that the ghost may still respond audibly if the player asks questions while the Spirit Box is being interfered with. This also counts as Spirit Box evidence.

notes.title: Non-Evidence
notes.description: The following does not count as evidence of Spirit Box: The ghost touching a door or an object, The ghost touching a door or an object (One ghost vocalisation involves the ghost repeatedly saying certain words; this is also not evidence of Spirit Box), Any other phenomenon not related to the Spirit Box.

notes.title: Ghost-Specific Abilities
notes.description: The Deogen has a 33% chance to respond with heavy breathing instead of a regular response if the player is standing within 1 metre of the ghost. The Moroi will curse the player who asked a question if they successfully obtain a response. The cursing response will not sound any different.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: It is recommended that the Spirit Box be used early on in the investigation as soon as the presumed favourite room has been found as using it effectively required a player to remain alone in the dark with the ghost for several seconds, thus considerably reducing their sanity and allowing a potential hunt to start. This is especially true for higher difficulties. As the Spirit Box emits a constant static when turned on, it may interfere with the ability to hear ghost activities properly. Turning it off is recommended when not in use. Ghost replies on the Spirit Box do not count as ghost events or interactions.

equipment.name: Thermometer
equipment.description: Displays the local temperature of a room. Can be used to detect Freezing Temperatures.
equipment.mechanics: The thermometer is a piece of starter equipment used to read the temperatures in the nearby environment, and is the primary tool for detecting Freezing Temperatures.

tiers.description: While moving through locations, ghosts will drop the temperature of the room they are currently in. Carry one of these thermometers into a room you think the ghost may be in and check the reading.
This Digital Thermometer is much faster at reading temperatures. Simply hold it, then hold Use and wait for it to scan the temperature of the room you are standing in.
An Air Thermometer that can scan temperatures much faster than its predecessor. It works the same way that the previous version did, just Grab one and hold Use to scan and receive a reading.

notes.title: Tier 1
notes.description: The Tier I Thermometer passively reads out the temperature of the last room in which the player held it, with the red liquid (alcohol) within slowly rising or falling depending on if the room is colder or warmer than where it was before. While very slow to update, with a rate of 0.33C per second, it benefits over its upgraded versions by being both completely passive, and is not an electronic item that could attract the ghost while held during a hunt. The thermometer reads out both Celsius (C) and Fahrenheit (F), with Celsius values on the left side and Fahrenheit on the right. The reading will fluctuate from the actual value by a maximum of +3 degrees, in Celsius.

notes.title: Tier 2
notes.description: The thermometer can be toggled to turn on the display. Holding down the use button will make the thermometer read the player's current room's temperature in degrees Celsius (C) every 2.5 seconds. This can be changed to Fahrenheit (F) in the settings. The reading will fluctuate from the actual value by a maximum of +3 degrees, in Celsius.

notes.title: Tier 3
notes.description: The thermometer can be toggled to turn on the display. Holding down the use button will make the thermometer read the player's current room's temperature in degrees Celsius (C) every 2.5 seconds. This can be changed to Fahrenheit (F) in the settings. The reading will fluctuate from the actual value by a maximum of +3 degrees, in Celsius. By default, the reading will be in degrees Celsius (C); this can be changed to Fahrenheit (F) in the settings. The reading will fluctuate from the actual value by a maximum of +2 degrees, in Celsius.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: Temperatures readings below 5C (41F) is generally an indication that the ghost is in (or was recently in) the room. This marker is less useful in non-clear weather on Maple Lodge Campsite, or when the fuse box has not been turned on long enough to raise temperatures. The tier II and III thermometers will continuously give out new readings when players hold Use after the initial reading while the tier I thermometer will refresh constantly, although at a much slower speed. When using thermometers thrown on the floor, turning it off and on again or moving between rooms before attempting to read the temperature may help to reduce the risk of errors.

equipment.name: UV Light
equipment.description: Used to reveal fingerprints and footprints created by ghosts.
equipment.mechanics: The UV light is a buyable starter item used to detect Ultraviolet evidence such as fingerprints and footprints.

tiers.description: This UV flashlight has a long-distance narrow beam of light, perfect for quickly searching for fingerprints and footprints without having to move too far. It also charges prints much faster than the Glowstick.

Use this Glowstick to grant an area light that slowly fades over time. Once the light has dulled, give it another shake to replenish some of the light. Ghosts can leave behind fingerprints and footprints in certain situations, use your UV light to reveal these. Shining UV light on these will charge them up over a frew seconds. Once charged you can remove the UV light and still have visibility of the prints, perfect for taking a photo.
With a much wider output and brighter source, this flashlight will allow even faster charging and finding of UV fingerprints or footprints.

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: The UV light can be enabled using the toggle key while holding it. The UV light can be activated at the same time as a standard flashlight, but any visible fingerprints or footprints may contrast poorly and be hard to see under their light. The UV light projects purple light and this light is weak relative to flashlights. The Tier I and III UV Lights will not work if Flashlights are turned off in custom difficulty settings. Ghosts that give ultraviolet evidence can leave prints on certain surfaces doors, light switches, and windows. They may also leave prints on floors after stepping through salt. These prints become visible and green when a UV light is shone towards them. The Tier I UV Light is a flashlight with a narrow spotlight. It counts as an electronic equipment. So it will flicker rapidly near a manifesting ghost and will attract the ghost during a hunt when it is nearby. Tier II UV Light is a small glowstick. When activated, it glows brightly for 1 minute, then fades to half intensity over the next 10 seconds. After dimming, the glowstick can be shaken with primary use to revitalize the light it produces. The tier III UV Light is also a flashlight. However, it has a much wider spotlight and a lesser charge time than tier I. It also counts as an electronic equipment.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: As of patch 0.9.0, UV prints must be illuminated by a UV light to take a successful photo. Many regard the Tier II UV Light as superior to the Tier I and III versions, due to the fact that the player can simply throw the glowstick on the floor and it will continuously illuminate any prints nearby, and it is also not an electronic, allowing the player to use it as a light source during hunts without the ghost detecting it.

equipment.name: Video Camera
equipment.description: Creates a video feed, which is relayed to the van's computer. Used to detect Ghost Orbs.
equipment.mechanics: When a video camera is picked up, the flip screen will open automatically. If the player is inside the van, they must get off the van for the flip screen to open. The video camera can be used handheld with its built-in display or placed on a flat surface or a tripod. Holding the placement key will show a translucent preview of the video camera and its facing direction, which can be adjusted while holding the placement key by moving the mouse left and right. Be aware that even though certain spots are shown as valid, the camera may tip over or fall due to the geometry or other objects placed on the surface. The video camera will automatically start streaming its video feed to the computer when open or placed. When the ghost manifests during a ghost event or a hunt, it will cause interference on all nearby video cameras and distort the image on both the built-in display and the video feed. Cameras of higher Tier with a better image quality will be significantly less impacted by ghost interference, aiding players in observing or tracking the ghost during a ghost event or a hunt. Ghosts may occasionally knock over placed down video cameras within a certain range, forcing players to actively tend to them. Placing a camera on a tripod will reduce the probability of the ghost knocking it over. The stability provided by the tripod will depend on its Tier. Night vision can be toggled while holding the active video camera or via the computer keyboard. When night vision is turned on, any Ghost Orbs present can be seen through the video camera.

tiers.description: This vintage camcorder may be old, but it's perfect for hunting down Ghost Orbs. Grab one and enter the location and start searching for a small spot of light dancing around in the room. Make sure to turn on your night vision first!
A video camera with a higher quality screen, better night vision, and more resistance against paranormal interference. It should make finding those sneaky Ghost Orbs just that little bit easier.
A large cinema-grade video camera, it's shoulder-mounted and heavy, but worth it for the additional visibility.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: The video camera's night vision function can be very useful when using a D.O.T.S Projector as the ghost's silhouette may be easier to see with night vision. The video camera can also be used to maintain surveillance on areas such as hallways, rooms, and the fuse box. This can allow for easy viewing of certain stationary evidence like Fingerprints, Ghost Writing, EMF Level 5, salt, or D.O.T.S Projector. However, the video feed becomes extremely distorted whenever the ghost manifests during a Ghost Event or a hunt, making observation very difficult. It is recommended to turn your flashlight (and room lights) off while using night vision.

equipment.name: Flashlight
equipment.description: Provides a basic source of light.
equipment.mechanics: The flashlight is an essential piece of equipment that is used to illuminate the area, usually in front of the player.

tiers.description: A retro metallic flashlight, which provides a small amount of light, just enough to get around.
This flashlight emits a much brighter beam of light.
Projecting a much wider cone of light, this flashlight is perfect for large rooms and open spaces.

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: Toggling on an equipped flashlight will provide a small conical range of light to improve visibility of the environment. The flashlight can also be put on the shoulder by cycling to another item, allowing its use offhand. When on the shoulder, the flashlight can be turned on or off by pressing the Special key. Non-VR players can carry only one flashlight at a time, while VR players can have any number of flashlights held or placed onto the toolbelt. Illuminated flashlights will continue providing light from the hips until a player manually turns it off. While on the toolbelt, emitted light will track the player's head movement. Up to 4 flashlights can be brought on a single contract. One flashlight is always provided per contract as a starter equipment. During a hunt, a flashlight will rapidly flicker if a ghost is within 10 metres (15 metres if it is a Raiju) and on the same floor. Like other electronic equipment, carrying a lit flashlight within 7.5 metres of the ghost during a hunt on the same floor will attract it.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: Extra flashlights can be dropped within dark areas of the map to provide illumination that remains unaffected by the state of the fuse box (though is subject to electronic interference during a hunt). This may be helpful if a ghost tampers with the lights and/or fuse box frequently.

equipment.name: Crucifix
equipment.description: Prevents ghosts from hunting in a certain radius.
equipment.mechanics: A crucifix can be held in the player's hand, thrown, or placed; the crucifix works in all three situations. Holding F will show the default effective range for the crucifix; this is a translucent sphere with a radius depending on its tier level (even if the ghost has a different effective range): Tier I: 3 metres, Tier II: 4 metres, Tier III: 5 metres. When the ghost attempts to initiate a hunt within the crucifix's range, the hunt will fail to begin, and a charge will be used. The ghost is then teleported back to its favourite room. Each time a crucifix successfully prevents a hunt, an EMF Level 2 reading is created, with a 25% chance for this to be EMF Level 5 if it is one of the ghost's evidences. For the Demon, the crucifix's effective range is increased by 50% for each tier: Tier I: 4.5 metres, Tier II: 6 metres, Tier III: 7.5 metres. The Tier I crucifix only has one charge, while tier II and tier III both have two charges. Each time it blocks a hunt attempt, a burning effect will appear, and the crucifix will glow visually before fading slightly darker. On first use, one arm of the crucifix will disappear. On second use, more parts of the crucifix will disappear. If a player-held crucifix successfully prevents a hunt attempt, it will automatically be thrown on the ground. After the crucifix is completely burnt, the crucifix will be useless and have no further effect on the ghost. In addition, the crucifix will not work if: The ghost is not within the specified range (even if the crucifix is located in the favourite room), A cursed possession is used to initiate a cursed hunt (Except for in the case of an unused tier III crucifix, which can be used to stop a cursed hunt at the cost of both its charges), A hunt has already started/is in progress. Each time a crucifix is used, the ghost must wait a minimum of 25 seconds (20 seconds for a Demon) before attempting to initiate another hunt. The crucifix range is not limited by any obstacle such as walls and doors. This includes exterior walls, which means that it is possible for crucifixes to be used outside provided the ghost is within its range inside the investigation area. 42 Edgefield Road is a good example of this, where a ghost near the front of the house, even upstairs, could possibly use up a crucifix still hanging on the van wall.

tiers.description: This crucifix can be held or placed to stop the ghost from initiating a single attack. Make sure to keep it placed near any activity you may find.
A metal crucifix that can be used to block two attacks, with a larger range. Remember to keep it in close proximity to any activity you come across.
This crucifix has an even larger range than its previous version. Additionally, an unused crucifix can prevent a cursed hunt, consuming both uses.

notes.title: Photo Rewards
notes.description: Taking a photo of a crucifix that has been used once or twice will yield a Burned Crucifix photo, rewarding up to $10 and 10XP depending on the distance the photo was taken from. Up to 4 Burned Crucifix photos can be obtained for two crucifixes. Additionally, if a crucifix is photographed within 20 seconds of preventing a hunt it will also yield an Interaction photo, rewarding up to $5 and 5XP. Therefore, a maximum number of 8 photo rewards can be obtained from two crucifixes.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: Although the crucifix works while held in-hand, it is strongly advised to place the crucifix on the ground, as this will free the player to do other objectives or hold onto more useful equipment during the investigation.

equipment.name: Firelight
equipment.description: Used for optional objectives, and to provide light.
equipment.mechanics: It is a deployable light source that can be lit using a source of fire such as an igniter or another firelight. It can be used to continuously light up a room with a warm, orange glow, and mitigate sanity drain from darkness, until it eventually burns out. Ghosts tend to blow out nearby firelights, making them effective at checking if a ghost is nearby.

tiers.description: This small candle will provide light and some sanity loss prevention, but only for a while, the wax burns down quite fast!

With three candles instead of one, the light provided is much brighter, longer range and lasts longer. Additionally, this Firelight doesn't need to be held to gain its effects, so you can place it and stand nearby to still receive the sanity benefits!

This lantern will last for the entirety of a contract, so there's no worry of it going out when you need it most. Just like its predecessor you can stand nearby to gain its effects. Lastly, it's waterproof so it even works in the rain!

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: Firelights may be purchased from the item store. Purchased firelights can be lit, grabbed, carried, and can slow sanity drain. Firelights also appear as candles on certain maps, but those candles can't be grabbed or carried, and have no effect on sanity drain.

notes.title: Lighting Firelights
notes.description: Players can light a firelight held in their hand by pressing Primary Use if they have an igniter in their inventory. A firelight placed down can be lit while holding an igniter and pressing Secondary Use. One can also hold a lit firelight, aim at an unlit firelight, and use the Secondary Use key. An unorthodox way is to have the wick of one lit and one unlit firelight to collide (this may need velocity).

notes.title: Placement
notes.description: Firelights can be placed down on surfaces. Holding the placement key will show a translucent highlight of the firelight. This will place the firelight upright relative to the surface. Firelights can topple/fall over when placed on a slope or vertically.

notes.title: Function
notes.description: Ghosts will occasionally blow out a firelight that is within 5 metres[1][2] of it. The fire will be extinguished with a blowing 'sigh' effect. Ghosts can blow out firelights at any time, even during hunts. A firelight will also extinguish by itself at the end of its duration which depends on its tier level. Tier I and Tier II firelights will produce smoke when blown by the ghost or self-extinguishing. Every third firelight that an Onryo blows out will cause it to attempt to initiate a hunt, regardless of sanity; the frequency of it blowing out firelights increases for every dead player. Having firelights nearby also act as crucifixes, being blown out instead of the Onryo hunting. Throwing a lit firelight/one falling with sufficient velocity (Tiers I and II only), placing it in the inventory, or leaving it out in heavy rain (Tiers I and II only) will cause it to extinguish. When a player is within 2 metres of a lit firelight, it will slow passive sanity drain that results from being in the dark, at a rate depending on the firelight's tier level. Lit firelights do not affect sanity drain from other sources such as ghost events or other players dying. The Tier II firelight counts as a single flame for all purposes.

notes.title: Maps
notes.description: Candles will also spawn in fixed locations on some maps: 6 Tanglewood Drive, 10 Ridgeview Court, 13 Willow Street, 42 Edgefield Road, Bleasdale Farmhouse, Grafton Farmhouse, Sunny Meadows Mental Institution. These candles cannot be picked up, cannot self-extinguish, and have no effect on sanity drain, but otherwise function normally.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: Placing firelights on the sides of tables, shelves, or other elevated objects may improve their lighting by covering a wider area. In larger maps like Brownstone High School or Sunny Meadows Mental Institution, firelights may be helpful as navigation markers for important areas such as the fuse box, ghost room, or exit door(s), though they are not as reliable as UV lights or spare flashlights, as firelights both burn out after a time (except for tier III) and can be blown out by the ghost. As firelights are not electronic, they are not affected by hunts and will continue to provide a steady light source. The downside is that players may not be able to tell when a hunt is occurring, especially if the ghost is too far away to be heard. In Sunny Meadows and its Restricted version, the candles in the chapel are lit by default and may be extinguished by the ghost, allowing the 'Get the Ghost to blow out a Firelight' objective to be completed without consuming a firelight or an igniter. However, this might also cause an unexpected early hunt if the ghost is an Onryo.

equipment.name: Head Gear
equipment.description: Can be equipped on a player's head. Will provide a video feed to the computer. Can be used to detect Ghost Orbs. To turn on head gear hold T(default).
equipment.mechanics: The Head Gear is a type of equipment in Phasmophobia. Its specific function varies based on its equipment tier, though generally it improves the ability to investigate without a Flashlight.

tiers.description: Strapping this small camera to your head allows your teammates to watch a live video feed of your view from the safety of the truck, great for multitasking and catching things that you may miss! To toggle the device on and off, hold the Special keybind for a couple of seconds.

A small head-mounted flashlight that doesn't take up an inventory slot. The only downside being the light isn't overly bright or wide. You can toggle it on and off by holding the Special keybind for a short period.

A pair of Night Vision goggles, allowing you to see in the dark without the need for a flashlight. Be warned though, your vision may get distorted if within range of an active ghost, rendering the goggles useless. To toggle the device on and off, hold the Special keybind for a couple of seconds.

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: Picking up a head gear will put it on the player's head. The head gear can be toggled on or off by holding the Special key for a couple of seconds. It can be placed back at any time. Worn Head Gear does not take up an inventory slot. The camera's display moves relative to the direction that the player's model is facing. Activated Head Gear will attract the ghost during hunts, similar to other electronic equipment.

notes.title: Tier 1
notes.description: Tier I Head Gear is the Head Mounted Camera. When activated, it functionally serves as a portable Video Camera, and can be used to help teams track each other and to see Ghost Orbs. Although useless when playing alone, they can be handy in a team with an observer in the Van. Like with regular video cameras, Head Mounted Cameras can switch between visual and night-vision modes at the Van, and can be used to detect Ghost Orbs when in night vision mode. They are also handy for monitoring players who have to be alone to get ghost responses, such as when using a Spirit Box, and are very useful for guiding players around larger maps, especially in the dark, since the player in the truck can see with night vision mode even if all the lights in the location are out, as well as having access to the Site Map. When the player equips the Tier I Head Gear, the player can see a big box-like object above the field of view. If it is activated, a red indicator light will start to blink.

notes.title: Tier 2
notes.description: Tier II Head Gear is the Head Lamp. When activated, it provides a light source emanating from the player's head, with comparable power and illumination to the Tier I Flashlight. The Tier II Head Gear is not visible in the player's field of view unless the player starts to sprint. Even while sprinting, the player can hardly see a part of it.

notes.title: Tier 3
notes.description: Tier III Head Gear is the Night Vision Goggles. When activated, it brightens visibility substantially, painting the player's view light green and allowing them to see in the dark, at the expense of added film grain, lowered render scale, and a slight fish-eye effect, altogether reducing the player's ability to see as far as they could have, and clearly. The display through Tier III Head Gear is a filter through normal vision, rather than a proper separate display as seen in a Video Camera in night-vision mode; an active UV Light will project a definite purple light, when through the video camera's night vision it would be white like from a (visible light spectrum) Flashlight, and Ghost Orbs cannot be seen through just the view provided by the goggles. When the player equips the Tier III Head Gear, the player can see a big goggle-like object above the field of view.

equipment.name: Igniter
equipment.description: Used to light firelight and incense. Can also be used on campfires in Maple Lodge Campsite and Camp Woodwind.
equipment.mechanics: An igniter is an item used to light incense, firelights, summoning circles, and campfires. It emits a small amount of light when activated and held by the player.

tiers.description: These matches are perfect for lighting Firelights and Incense, but remember, with only ten uses you'll run out fast! They can also be used as a small light source, just make sure to not burn your fingers.
A gas lighter. It provides a little more light than matches and lasts a lot longer. You can see the liquid inside it drain as you use it, make sure you have enough left when you're in a pinch!

This Lighter could last you for an entire contract, as long as you're not wasting it! With a larger flame, the light it provides is brighter and has larger range, perfect for those dark getaways during an attack.

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: An igniter can be used either when held or when in the inventory. The igniter can be lit by pressing the Primary Use key while holding it. Incense, summoning circle candles and regular firelight can then be lit by aiming at the item and pressing the Secondary Use key. Alternatively, if the igniter is offhand in the inventory, incense or firelight being held on-hand can be lit directly with Primary Use. The igniter does not have to be lit prior in this case, as it will automatically turn off when placed offhand. Igniters take up their own special slot in the inventory, allowing for three other items to be carried with them. Igniters have a limited amount of usable time, depending on their tier: Tier I: 10 matches per box with 10 seconds per match, for a total of 100 seconds (1 minute 40 seconds), Tier II: 5 minutes, Tier III: 10 minutes. Additionally, lighting a held incense or firelight while the igniter is offhand in the inventory will instantly deduct 1 match for the Tier I and 15 seconds of the total fuel for the Tiers II and III. Active Tier I and Tier II igniters are affected by Heavy Rain, and will be extinguished automatically when taken outside and cannot be ignited in that weather, excepting places that are covered from the rain (e.g. under porch roofs, inside tents). However, they can still light held incense and Tier III firelights up if they are in the inventory, even while fully outside. Ghosts can occasionally blow out igniter flames within 5 metres of them. Tier I and II igniters are consumable, and will have to be repurchased after use.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: While using tier I igniters, it is quicker to pick up, light and place firelights than to wait for the match-striking animation. Shortly after being blown out, taking a picture of an igniter with a Photo Camera will yield an easy interaction photo.

equipment.name: Incense
equipment.description: Used to prevent a ghost from hunting for a short period of time. Can also be used during a hunt to blind the ghost temporarily.
equipment.mechanics: Incense is a purchasable item that will deter the ghost from hunting for a period of time when burned.

tiers.description: You can light Incense with any Igniter to stop a ghost from initiating a hunt for a long duration, additionally, you can use it during a hunt when near a ghost to disorient it for a few seconds.

Much more sage has been used to create this incense bundle, allowing for a longer burn time, keeping you safer for longer during attacks. Additionally, it will slow the movement of the ghost for part its effect duration.

With a much larger range and longer burn time, you can ward off ghosts much more safely when attacked. When the ghost is initially repelled it will be stunned, halting it's movement for a short period.

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: To light incense, have an igniter in the inventory, hold the incense, then press the Primary Use key. Incense thrown on the ground can also be lit by aiming at it while holding an igniter or firelight, then pressing Secondary Use. Once lit, the incense will emit smoke for a certain amount of time depending on the tier level: Tier I: 5 seconds, Tier II: 6 seconds, Tier III: 7 seconds. While burning, the incense attempts multiple times[verification needed] per second to successfully apply its effect(s), but can only apply the effect(s) once. When the incense is used up, the smoke will stop being emitted and the model will finish burning to a stub. There is no explicit indication of whether the incense was used effectively or not. Used incense can still be handheld, but since there's nothing to use, it is normally discarded.

notes.title: Effects
notes.description: The incense has a range in which the ghost must be for its effects to be successfully applied. This range depends on the tier level: Tier I: 3 metres, Tier II: 4 metres, Tier III: 5 metres

notes.title: Regular Cleansing
notes.description: When the ghost is within the incense's range while it is burning, the following will occur: Ghost activity will be increased marginally, The ghost will be unable to initiate a hunt on its own for a certain duration: (Demon 60 seconds, Spirit 180 seconds, All Other 90 seconds), If the ghost is a Yurei, it will also return to its favorite room and cannot roam out for 90 seconds. This will not prevent ghost events from happening outside the room. Lighting incense will not prevent cursed hunts nor stop an already ongoing hunt, but doing this during a hunt will prevent further attempts to initiate regular hunts for the specified duration starting from when the incense effect is applied. If another incense is used while this effect from a previous incense is ongoing, this effect will not be re-applied and the timer will not be reset. Due to a quirk in how incense works, ghosts which are standing on stairs will not be affected by the 'cleansing' property of incense, though they will be affected by the 'blinding' ability described below.

notes.title: Blinding During Hunts
notes.description: Incense can be used to 'blind' the ghost during a hunt. For this effect to apply, the ghost must be within the incense's range. When the effect is successfully applied, the ghost will: Be unable to detect or kill players; one can walk through it without dying, Walk in a random direction, similar to its 'wandering phase', Additionally, the Tier II Incense will slow down the ghost, and the Tier III Incense will halt the ghost. This effect lasts for 5 seconds (7.5 seconds for a Moroi). After this period, the ghost will return to its regular hunting behaviour, and be able to see and kill players again. Multiple incenses can be used for the same purpose during the same hunt with no diminishing returns, to blind the ghost for up to 20 seconds (30 for a Moroi) consecutively. If another incense is used while this effect from a previous incense is ongoing, this effect will be re-applied and the timer will be reset.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: When lighting incense near a ghost during a hunt, the ghost may coincidentally take the same path as a player, especially in tight hallways. It does not mean that the ghost can still see the player. Light the incense near (but not in) a hiding spot, so that you can reach it before the ghost is no longer blind. If you are not the host, and especially if there is some latency between you and the server, the game may register the ghost killing the player before the incense effect actually applies. To avoid this, try lighting the incense earlier.

equipment.name: Motion Sensor
equipment.description: Provides light when a ghost or player passes it. A signal is also provided to the Van.
equipment.mechanics: The motion sensor is a piece of equipment that can help in tracking the movement of the ghost.

tiers.description: Place this motion sensor on walls or the floor and it will flash any time something moves in front of it, even things you can't see.

With two different modes, a longer range, and a sound indicator, this sensor is perfect for paranormal tracking. You can toggle the laser shape by Interacting with the sensor after it has been placed.
Place this Motion Sensing camera on the floor near to any ghost activity you may find. When activated, it will turn and flash a bright light whenever a ghost enters or exits its detection range.

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: A motion sensor can used by placing it. After being placed, it can be turned off by interacting with it.

notes.title: Tier 1
notes.description: The Tier I Motion Sensor can either be placed on the wall or on the floor. When placed, the sensor will emit a red laser beam, indicating its effective detection distance. If it is placed on a wall, it will also display on the Site Map in the van as a red bar. When a player, the ghost, the airball, or an object passes through its laser beam, the motion sensor will emit a bright light for 2 seconds. The bar on the site map will also turn green for 6 seconds, and an audible beep will play from the monitor. Motion sensors that are not displayed will still play the beep.

notes.title: Tier 2
notes.description: The Tier II Motion Sensor is similar to the Tier I Motion Sensor and adds a conical mode which can be switched to by interacting with it. The conical mode allows the sensor to have a second laser beam that can help players track the ghost's movement more accurately, as its lights will be emitted from left to right, or from right to left, depending on the direction of the movement. Additionally, the Tier II Motion Sensor will directly emit an audible beep when it detects movement.

notes.title: Tier 3
notes.description: The Tier III Motion Sensor can only be placed on the floor and has a 1.5-metre spherical range that is displayed as a red circle on the site map in the van. When the ghost enters this range, the sensor will quickly rotate to the location it detected the ghost, and will emit a small light and an audible beep. On the site map, the red circle will turn green for 6 seconds. When the ghost exits the range, the sensor will only rotate to the location it detected the ghost and emit a light, without beeping.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: Placing motion sensors at corners or room boundaries can help to track where the ghost is.

equipment.name: Parabolic Microphone
equipment.description: Used to listen to paranormal sounds in a large range.
equipment.mechanics: The parabolic microphone, sometimes referred to as a paramic, is a piece of equipment in Phasmophobia. It can detect sound through walls and at a great distance. It serves as a portable version of the sound sensor. Although generally disregarded for smaller maps, it may come in handy on larger ones (such as Brownstone High School and Sunny Meadows Mental Institution) for locating the ghost.

tiers.description: While using the Parabolic Microphone and attached headphones, you will be able to hear sounds further away than normal, depending on which way you are aiming the microphone.

We've improved this Parabolic Microphone with a couple upgrades; a better sensor and a small screen. Turning it on will allow you to hear distance sounds, as well as get a visual reading on how loud that sound is.

This Parabolic Microphone has been improved with a visual sound indicator. Each time a sound is detected within the microphone's range, a visual indicator will be shown on the screen, including distance and volume, allowing you to easily track where the sound is coming from.

notes.title: Paranormal Sounds
notes.description: The parabolic microphone allows the player to hear an idle ghost's paranormal sounds (voices, growls, etc.), as well as amplifying any other sounds. The parabolic microphone must be inside the building to detect sounds. When activated, the player will distinctively hear the sounds produced in front of the microphone with an angle of 110 horizontally, whether they are made by the ghost, another player, active equipment, or ambient noises, while all other sounds will be muffled. The parabolic microphone allows the player to hear an idle ghost's paranormal sounds (voices, growls, etc.), as well as amplifying any other sounds. The parabolic microphone must be inside the building to detect sounds. When activated, the player will distinctively hear the sounds produced in front of the microphone with an angle of 110 horizontally, whether they are made by the ghost, another player, active equipment, or ambient noises, while all other sounds will be muffled.

notes.title: Inaudible Sounds
notes.description: An idle ghost's paranormal sounds are normally inaudible. Those sounds become audible to a player using a parabolic microphone. Paranormal sounds can only be heard when aiming toward the ghost. Mylings make paranormal sounds more often than other ghosts. Banshees have a certain chance of using a unique paranormal sound. Moroi will curse players who hear their whispers, resulting in an increased passive sanity drain.

notes.title: Tier 1
notes.description: The Tier I Parabolic Microphone has a range of 20 metres forward. It has a red light that will flicker when it detects a sound.

notes.title: Tier 2
notes.description: The Tier II Parabolic Microphone has a range of 30 metres forward and has an additional screen which will display three sets of numbers: The largest number display (000.0) measures the total sum of sound detected from all sources. The Min and Peak values display the quietest and loudest individual sound levels picked up, respectively. For example, if a 16 dB sound, a 17 dB sound, and a 19 dB sound are picked up, Min will display 16 dB and Peak will display 19 dB, with the total sound level being 52 dB. For example, if a 16 dB sound, a 17 dB sound, and a 19 dB sound are picked up, Min will display 16 dB and Peak will display 19 dB, with the total sound level being 52 dB.

notes.title: Tier 3
notes.description: The Tier III Parabolic Microphone is similar to the Tier II Parabolic Microphone but it additionally includes a sonar function, allowing its screen to display the position, and the volume of each individual sound. It can also detect sounds one floor above or below the user.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: The player should remain aware of other noise disturbances, such as doors being opened or closed by players. Coordinate with others and communicate to know whether a sound might have originated from a player or the ghost.

equipment.name: Photo Camera
equipment.description: Used to take photos of various ghost interactions for additional profit.
equipment.mechanics: The photo camera is a piece of equipment in Phasmophobia. It is a digital camera that can be used to take pictures of objects in-game. While it is not used for gathering evidence, it is essential for acquiring photo rewards, as well as being necessary for certain objectives and tasks.

tiers.description: You can use this camera to take photos of any evidence you may find. It will only interfere with the ghost during the photo taking process, so be careful when you decide to snap a picture. For more information on how to take photos check the 'Photos' section in you Journal.
With this digital photo camera, you can snap pictures of evidence and paranormal entities much faster than the previous Tier.

This top-of-the-range camera provides the lowest delay time between photos, allowing quick evidence gathering. Additionally, it's been modified to be less susceptible to paranormal entities causing interference with the screen during manifestations.

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: The photo camera automatically turns on while held outside the van. For the Tier II and III cameras, an additional display shows a preview of what the camera will capture at the moment it is used, and helps players frame the photo subject. Each photo camera can take an unlimited number of photos, but only the first 10 pictures taken will count towards earning photo rewards and completing objectives. Upon taking a picture, the flash will go off, and a photo preview will show up on the camera for Tier II and III cameras. Any pictures taken of a reflective surface will show the lens flash in the picture, such as a television, or the axe that one of the possible ghost models wields. The cooldown between photo depends on the Tier of the photo camera (3 seconds for Tier I, 2 seconds for Tier II, and 1 second for Tier III). When a ghost manifests during a ghost event or a hunt, the photo camera's display will be distorted, as well as any pictures taken. Pictures taken in this state will still be labeled in the journal if a valid subject is detected. Holding a Tier II or III photo camera within 7.5 metres of a ghost (2.5 metres for the Yokai) during a hunt on the same floor will attract the ghost. The Tier I photo camera will only attract the ghost when a picture is taken. However, due to a bug, if a Tier I photo camera is cycled into the inventory within 2.13 seconds after taking a photo, it will stay electronic until another photo is taken with it.

notes.title: Photo Rewards
notes.description: The first 10 labeled pictures recorded in the journal will reward the player with experience and points depending on the photo category and starring in the journal, added together as 'photo evidence'. A maximum of $110 and 110 XP can be obtained at the end of a contract. There are different limits on how many times each photo category will provide rewards. For example, only one photo of the bone or of the ghost will be credited, but an unlimited amount of different interaction photos can be taken and rewarded accordingly. If there are no available slots for photos inside the journal (which can hold 10 photos for the whole team, stars or no stars), any further shots will not net any monetary gains. If a shot is missed or judged unsatisfactory, players have the option to delete up to two photos from the journal. In multiplayer, an unanimous vote from all players is required to delete a photo, signaled by a red icon on the Photos tab of the Journal. Three-star photos cannot be deleted.

equipment.name: Salt
equipment.description: Places salt piles that ghosts can interact with to leave footprints.
equipment.mechanics: Salt is a purchasable item used to place salt piles. Ghosts can step in the salt pile, and it can be used to check for Ultraviolet evidence, or to obtain photo rewards.

tiers.description: While holding this container, you can place piles of Salt on the floor in the hope of tracking the ghost. We recommend placing them in doorways and near turns in hallways or rooms for the highest chance of getting a reaction.
This larger container holds more salt than its predecessor, allowing you to place long lines of salt to easily block wider passages.

This salt is so powerful it can affect a ghost's mobility in two ways. Whilst a ghost is acting passively, these lines will act like a barrier, forcing the ghost to turn around when walking into one. Great for trapping those roaming ghosts in a room so you can find your evidence. If its during an attack, the ghost will be slowed, giving you extra time to make your escape.

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: A salt container can be used to place salt piles on the floor. Each salt container can be used 2-3 times, allowing a maximum of 6-9 salt piles to be placed per game with 3 salt containers. Salt piles can be stacked in the same spot. When a ghost walks over a salt pile, it will leave an indent in the pile. This can happen any time, regardless of the ghost being invisible or not. Within the next few seconds after the salt has been stepped in, if the ghost has Ultraviolet evidence, the ghost will also leave temporary footprints visible under UV light where it chooses to roam. Wraiths will never leave any imprint on salt piles, walking over them as if they do not exist. Players cannot leave an imprint in salt piles or generate footprints.

notes.title: Tier 1
notes.description: The Tier I salt shaker has two uses, and places a small, circular pile of white salt on the ground. A sole-like imprint will be left in the pile once a ghost steps over it.

notes.title: Tier 2
notes.description: The Tier II salt jar has three uses, and places a long pile of pink salt, making it easier for the ghost to step on. The middle of the salt pile will disappear when the ghost steps on it.

notes.title: Tier 3
notes.description: The Tier III salt jar has three uses, and places a long pile of black salt, identical in size to Tier II salt. If the ghost steps on a black salt pile during a hunt, its speed will be reduced by 50% for 2 seconds. If it steps on another black salt pile before the 2 seconds are over, the timer will be reset but the ghost will not be further slowed down. If the ghost steps on the salt pile outside of a hunt, it will turn around and go back the way it came briefly. It has no effect during ghost events. As Wraiths ignore salt entirely, none of these effects will apply to them even if they physically pass through it.

notes.title: Photo Rewards
notes.description: Taking a photo of a stepped-in salt pile will yield a Disturbed Salt photo, rewarding up to $5 and 5XP depending on the distance the photo was taken from and the framing of the salt.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: If placed strategically, salt can be used to track exactly where the ghost is walking after it has been located, potentially to the players' advantage. Placing salt close to external corners in wide hallways or rooms with acute angles will maximize the chances of the ghost stepping in the salt. This is because the ghost is programmed to take the shortest route to its next waypoint when wandering, therefore it is more likely to navigate by hugging corners and other turns. Dropping a UV Light near the salt pile will illuminate any footprints present without having to hold the UV light. Using tier III salt can help in taking 3-star ghost photos during hunts as it slows down the ghost.

equipment.name: Sanity Medication
equipment.description: Restores the consumer's sanity by a certain amount dependent on Difficulty.
equipment.mechanics: Sanity Medication is a purchasable item that is used to replenish a player's sanity.

tiers.description: Drink this bottle of vintage snake oil to restore a portion of your sanity. It will take a few seconds to complete the restoration, and the amount restored will depend on the difficulty you are playing.
Taking these pills will restore your Sanity faster. You can take several pots to increase the amount of Sanity restored over its duration.
This Adrenaline Shot will restore your sanity much faster than the previous two versions, additionally, you will not lose any sprint stamina for the entire duration of its effects.

notes.title: Tier 3 Sprint Boots
notes.description: Once consumed, the Tier III sanity medication grants the player a sprint boost for 10 seconds, which means the player can run without exhaustion during that period. During the boost, the player can hear the heartbeat noise. After the boost, the user will normally consume the sprint stamina until they are exhausted. Consuming a Tier III sanity medication while a sprint boost is active doesn't extend the sprint boost time.

notes.title: Sanity Replenished
notes.description: Consuming sanity medication will replenish a certain amount of the player's sanity up to the maximum of 100%, depending on difficulty: Amateur - 40%, Intermediate - 35%, Professional - 30%, Nightmare - 25%, Insanity - 20%. Consuming sanity medication will cause it to drop from the player's hand, and that item will no longer be consumable. Sanity medication cannot be consumed if the player's sanity is above 95%.

notes.title: Sanity Restoration Speed
notes.description: Depending on the tier of the medication, the speed of restoration will differ (the tier does not change the amount of sanity restored). It is recommended to stay outside of the house/in the van until the full sanity amount has been restored in order to accurately track sanity for hunts. Tier I: 20 seconds, Tier II: 10 seconds, Tier III: 10 seconds

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: Strategically used, sanity medication can help to stave off hunts by bringing the average sanity back above the ghost's hunt sanity threshold. They can also be used to allow for further usage of cursed possessions such as Ouija Boards, to avoid breaking the possession. Sanity medication could even be used to identify ghosts based by seeing if they hunt above a certain threshold (e.g. Shade), or by performing a test for the Moroi. If one's aim is to delay hunts through sanity medication, specifically on multiplayer, one possible way to do this would be to distribute the sanity medication so that the overall sanity drain is slower on average. For example, if just one player is at 0% sanity and the remaining players have enough sanity to be above the hunt threshold, then these remaining players should take the sanity medication instead of the 0% player. This would make it so that less players are reducing the average sanity of the entire team. Another example is when all players are at varying levels of sanity; the players who tend to manage their sanity better could take the sanity medication, as long as this keeps the average sanity above the hunt threshold. Note that results may vary depending on factors such as the hunt sanity threshold, the ghost type, or players dying.

equipment.name: Sound Sensor
equipment.description: Detects near inaudible sounds in an area, and relays the data to the Van.
equipment.mechanics: The Sound Sensor is a piece of Equipment in Phasmophobia. It detects sounds in a large area around it, allowing the player to track potential ghost activity in combination with the Sound Monitor.

tiers.description: Place these sound sensors down in locations where you want to track any audio interactions. Once placed, return to the Truck, you can listen to the remote playback whilst checking the Sound Sensor screen to see if any of the Sensors receive any readings.
This sound sensor has been improved to feature three different size settings, togglable with a size button on the Sound Sensor screen in the truck.

The tripod has rotational joints on it, allowing you to Interact with it to change the shape of the Sound Sensor. Each shape is represented by the directions that the microphones are facing: Forward: Cone / Outward: Sides / Inward: Sphere

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: A sound sensor can be placed on the ground or other flat surface. The detection area is highlighted as an orange circle on the Site Map in the van. The sound sensor picks up most noises, except for players talking through local and global chat. Any noise picked up by a sensor will appear as a bar on the Sound Monitor, showing how loud the sound was and identifying which sensor picked up the sound. The screen will display the total volume of all sounds detected. The value displayed will update every second. By default, the sound sensor picks up sound in a 5-meter radius on the same floor, ignoring walls. This radius can be increased by clicking on the enlargement icon on the Sound Monitor in the van. The sound sensor can also be muted by clicking on the speaker icon. The Tier III Sound Sensor has two additional modes which can be switched to by interacting with it while it is placed, or toggling directly while in hand. These modes can't be switched from the van.

notes.title: Tips
notes.description: Placing sound sensors in a central area of several rooms is a good way to cover a lot of ground when looking for the ghost's location early on. Sound sensors detect the noise of the Haunted Mirror if it is in their range.

equipment.name: Tripod
equipment.description: Used as a mount for Video Cameras. Lowers the chance for ghost to throw a Video Camera.
equipment.mechanics: Tripods are used to mount video cameras, essentially acting as a portable surface for them.

tiers.description: Attach a Video Camera to this Tripod by Placing it on top. You can then carry the Tripod and Place it in locations that may not have a good surface for viewing paranormal activity. Ghosts may interfere with your placed cameras and attempt to knock them over, make sure to reset them back up if they are pushed to the floor.
This Tripod has been upgraded with a rotational motor. While viewing the Video Camera's view from the truck, you can use the on-screen controls to rotate the tripod motor, giving you a new angle.
Like its previous versions, this Tripod is similar except much sturdier, those pesky ghosts should knock it over much less frequently.

notes.title: Usage
notes.description: Picking up a video camera and placing it on top of the tripod will mount the camera on the tripod. Carrying the tripod afterwards will bring the camera along as well, so the player does not need to carry both an empty tripod and an unmounted video camera. The video camera can be removed from the tripod by grabbing it. A tripod can be placed by dropping it, making it drop below the player in the direction they are facing. Tripods can also be placed via the Secondary Use key; holding this key will show a translucent outline of its placement, which can be adjusted by moving the mouse left or right. Tripods are bulky items, and thus take up your hand slot while carrying it; they cannot be stored in your inventory, and switching to another item or hand while carrying a tripod will automatically drop the tripod. Additionally, tripods will hinder player movements when walked through, forcing player to more carefully chose where to place them. The tripod will allow players to position video cameras in places where no suitable surface is available, but will also reduce the likeliness of the ghost knocking over the camera than if it was placed down on its own. The stability of the tripod against ghost tempering will depend on its tier. Additionally, Tier II and III tripods have a motorized mount, allowing to rotate the camera left or right by using the arrows in the bottom right corner of the computer in the van.

notes.title: Strategies
notes.description: The rotation feature of the Tier II and III tripods may allow players to observe the entirety of the room with a single camera, allowing to more easily find Ghost orbs or track the ghost during a hunt.
